name: Turtle Rock
description: Turtle Rock is a prominent rock formation in Joshua Tree National Park, offering climbers and hikers stunning views of the desert landscape. It's a popular spot for bouldering and is named for its resemblance to a turtle.

name: Silver Salmon Creek
park: Lake Clark National Park and Preserve
description: Silver Salmon Creek is renowned for its wildlife viewing opportunities, particularly for watching brown bears fishing for salmon. Visitors can also enjoy kayaking, fishing, and scenic views of the Alaskan wilderness.

name: Chilkoot Trail
park: Klondike Gold Rush National Historical Park
description: The Chilkoot Trail is a historic route that was heavily used during the Klondike Gold Rush. Hikers can follow in the footsteps of prospectors through rugged terrain, experiencing stunning views and historical sites along the way.

name: St. Mary Lake
description: St. Mary Lake is the second largest lake in Glacier National Park, known for its deep blue waters and surrounding mountain peaks. It offers excellent opportunities for boating, fishing, and photography.

name: Twin Lake
park: Lake Clark National Park and Preserve
description: Twin Lake, located in the remote wilderness of Lake Clark National Park, offers a serene setting for canoeing, fishing, and wildlife observation. The area is known for its pristine natural beauty and tranquility.

name: Lake McDonald
description: Lake McDonald is the largest lake in Glacier National Park, offering spectacular views of the surrounding mountains. Visitors can enjoy boating, fishing, and exploring the scenic Going-to-the-Sun Road.

name: Charley Rivers
description: Charley Rivers National Preserve is a remote wilderness area in Alaska, offering pristine rivers for rafting and canoeing. The preserve is rich in wildlife, including moose, caribou, and bears, and provides opportunities for solitude and adventure.

name: Icy Bay
park: Wrangell-St. Elias National Park and Preserve
description: Icy Bay is a stunning glacial bay in Wrangell-St. Elias National Park, known for its dramatic icebergs and surrounding snow-capped peaks. The bay is accessible by boat and offers unparalleled views of the Alaskan coast.

name: Rainbow Lake
description: Rainbow Lake is a popular fishing spot in Alaska, known for its abundance of rainbow trout. The lake is surrounded by scenic wilderness, offering opportunities for boating, camping, and wildlife viewing.

name: Hidden Lake
description: Hidden Lake in North Cascades National Park offers a peaceful retreat with crystal-clear waters and scenic hiking trails. The lake is a favorite spot for backcountry camping and enjoying the rugged beauty of the Cascades.

name: Chincoteague
description: Chincoteague is famous for its wild ponies and beautiful beaches. The Chincoteague National Wildlife Refuge offers visitors opportunities for bird watching, hiking, and enjoying the pristine coastal environment.

name: Lake Umbagog
description: Lake Umbagog is a tranquil lake straddling the border of New Hampshire and Maine, known for its excellent fishing and paddling opportunities. The surrounding Umbagog National Wildlife Refuge is home to diverse wildlife, including loons and moose.
